name: InterContinental Nairobi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is quite old but well maintaned so it has its standard. We liekd the buffet at the restaurant very much. it was on December 24th and we got our turkey there, quite good actually. The rooms is good but as always in Africa the price of the hotel is unacceptable for what you are getting. But then agian they are all in it togeather.
reviews.title: Fine but overpriced

reviews.text: Service was good and friendly an food prices are ok.
reviews.title: Needs to improve ASAP!!

reviews.text: Good option if you want to stay downtown Nairobi.
reviews.title: A busy conference hotel that badly needs a refurb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 6 nights...had to wait in line for more than 15 minutes to check-in...and this happened in the Priority Club desk...staff were friendly (esp. Restaurant and Kitchen staff..personnel at Front Desk looked weary)...Lobby area would look like what you'd expect from an InterContinental but once you get to your room, it's a whole different story...the size and cleanliness of room were no issue...furniture were quite old and needs to go..had torn curtains with duct tape to "cover the holes?"..the bathroom was shocking...it felt like a bathroom you'd find in a bad hostel..it had stains all over the wall, sink, bathtub, etc...to be honest, it was kinda nasty...housekeeping were friendly too but everytime I had a request (laundry, towels, etc) it would take them at least 2-3 hours that a couple of times I completely forgot I called them in the first place...I still don't understand how guesthouses include WiFi in your US$20 room yet the InterContinental still charges this service to their guests...location was the main reason we stayed here since it was a couple of blocks from Conference Center...not a place I'd stay if I were on a Leisure trip.
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.text: An over fullconference hotel..depiste booking six months ago people sin out groups till not getting their rooms. or then only after midnight whilst being cleaned. ITotall full an dservices suffer as a result. It seems top dollar pays over long term reservcations. As busy attracting conferences the poolsid e and garden is used as a venue so not possible to swim or lie./relax outdoors the week I was there unless surrounded by suited men.
reviews.title: a cheap and nasty two star hotel, not what was expected

reviews.text: unfortenatly some reviewers are very right
reviews.title: not good enough

reviews.text: i had a superior room , but the bathroon was like 3 square meters , last rufurnished in 1971 i think. plumbing is horrible , you heare all the bathroomnoises from the rooms next up and under you . staff is extremely unhappy , not seen one smile , checking in and out takes much to long . very safe though , but if i want to sleep in total security i would go to a police station , not to a hotel were the safety procedures are striker than in New york airport after 911 . expensive an bad breakfast . very good bed though . very expensive for the way they treat you . i dont believe they ever tried to understand the word hospitality. better try fairview , fairmont or hilton if you want this kind of hotels in the center.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!

reviews.text: Whatever you do, DON'T STAY HERE! This hotel is incredibly old, falling apart, and not up to par with regular Intercontinental Hotel standards, surprising especially since I'm paying ~$250 USD per night before taxes. Things that went wrong:
reviews.title: Centrally Located Business Hotel

reviews.text: -Upon checking into the room, my internet (wired and wireless) wasn't working so they had to call an engineer here to take a couple of hours to fix it. Couldn't switch me to another room because they were full. Internet is NOT free either.
reviews.title: Don't go there if you have kids or if you would like to have a good sleep..

reviews.text: -Electric outlets randomly DO NOT WORK and cannot charge anything!
reviews.title: A home away from home, thanks to Nairobi's best concierge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the InterContinental before, during and after our safari. The first two stays, in different rooms, were horrible. The drapes, shears, and lamp shades were coated with dust, One room had greasy handprints on the bathroom door. The toilet in our first room had to be flushed five or six times before it got the job done. Our final two nights we paid extra to upgrade and finally got a clean room. The rooms at this hotel most certainly do not meet InterContinental standards. Rooms definitely need a major upgrade.
reviews.title: Filthy

reviews.text: We stayed here for a night before embarking on a safari. It was a pleasant stay. Our flight arrived at 6 am but the check in was smooth. The rooms were large and clean. Service was a little slow but it was not a big problem. The staff was smiling, helpful with directions and information and could communicate in good English.The swimming pool was supposed to be heated but we did not have the time to try it out. The Italian restaurant was good, so was the one that served buffet dinner and breakfast,(I forgot its name), did not try not the Indian one. The gift shop was expensive, the highway curio shops were a better bargain. There was a supermarket at a walking distance where we stacked up on snacks, water as well as buying a local sim card and internet connection.
reviews.title: Satisfactory

reviews.text: Effecient and friendly check in process. For a hotel in this part of the world the security is a little light. It is there, its gated, there are security folks around, but it would be pretty easy to poke a hole in their security perimeter - if you could call it that.
reviews.title: Solid business class hotel

reviews.text: Room was clean, if a little tired, furniture relatevely modern, TV and electronics are up to date. Bed was good quality, comfortable and the linens were nice. Not sure the threadcount:)
reviews.title: By far the best in Nairobi......

reviews.text: Intenet connectivity in the room was quite good. No problem with streaming video or downloading large files.
reviews.title: Good location and staff but in dire need of an upgrade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed two nights in room #505. The hotel appears to have been grand once, but is now a little shoddy. The staff is great and the food is pretty good. A yummy breakfast buffet and good food by the bar/pool area. The area is safe for Nairobi, but to get around the staff recommend a cab – even for a ten-minute walk in daylight. The traffic to airport on a Friday night was the worst traffic I’ve ever seen – makes Boston and NYC look tame. I didn’t get to have a massage, but one tourmate did and she said it was really good – and cheap, too. Our room keys never worked. The front desk can do currency exchange or get you money back from your credit card.
reviews.title: Decent place, nice staff, good food

reviews.text: Stayed here for business. the check in was a small problem that was due to lots of being trying to check in at the same time. we got free drinks for waiting. that was nice, it made a good impression on me. the room is great, the place is clean and the staff are all friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Good business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good breakfast and nice indian resturant. if your in nairobi for business. this is a good place to stay.
reviews.title: An outsanding service

reviews.text: I was staying at the Intercontinental Nairobi after my trip to Egypt was canceled due to the demonstration.The whole check in experience was excellent n we were received with quite hospitality of the highest magnitude;we were provided with glasses of juices and a warm towel and the actual check in just took 4 minutes.
reviews.title: Way too Expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What amazed me a lot was the experience and knowledge of one of the porters a Mr Abgao Asad who's diverse experience of the facilities in and outside the hotel were amazing.
reviews.title: Surprised Intercontinental chain would associate with this hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Intercontinental on the 29th of May as well as on the 4th and 5th of June, 2001. The hotel is well located within the city and is walking distance from a mall as well as good eating joints. The coffee shop serves excellent buffet lunches and dinners and also has an authentic Indian restaurant. The hotel staff was helpful as we were travelling with two children and organised comfortable extra beds in the room.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Comfortable rooms

reviews.text: Overall a very comfortable stay
reviews.title: You know a 5 star hotel when you get into the lobby, and this one IS ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon a return from the Seychelles a week and a half ago I stayed my initial two nights at the Intercontinental Hotel before heading out on a short safari into the Rift Valley.
reviews.title: Standard Interconti with excellent breakfast

reviews.text: The evening arrival at the front desk was no problem as my room had been held, even in case of a delayed flight, but as Kenya Airways was spot on time it was the Nairobi traffic which delayed me in reaching the hotel.
reviews.title: Very good hotel in good location

reviews.text: I had requested 'my' suite on the 7th floor and it was presenting itself again at its 'Sunday best', fruit basket, a welcome letter from management and the bathrooms equipped with amenities of the finest pedigree.
reviews.title: 4* hotel in good location
So worn out.. not Intercontinental standard at all
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night as part of a group visiting the safaris in Kenya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Good Spot, Decent food, and unbelievably slow internet.

reviews.text: - One of the very few international large-scale chain hotels in Kenya (I believe the rest are Crowne Plaza, Hilton and this)
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.text: - Close to city center and the parliament
reviews.title: Just as I remember it
Good hotel for business
reviews.text: - Service was friendly

Like most Intercontinental, the InterCon in Nairobi was comfortable with large rooms and a stone's throw from Uhuru Park. The staff was exceptionally helpful and went out of their way to make sure that everything was fine. The hotel's has good conference facilities and several meeting rooms. The breakfast spread was large and great value for money. The hotel's security is also good which made one feel safe and comfortable.
reviews.title: Safe and comfortable

reviews.text: As a business traveler, I have stayed at Intercontinental Nairobi on six different occasions. However my recent stay (Oct 2010) made it more obvious why I will not be staying at this hotel again:
reviews.title: Very slow service - Check in

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Getting tired, good down town location though

reviews.text: 1. The waiting staff (waiters) at various restaurants throughout the hotel were great and made effort to ensure that one was well served

reviews.text: Hotel seems heavy guarded, but eventually you can bring whatever you want from the street.
reviews.title: Nice Amenities - Horrible Standard Rooms

reviews.text: Reception staff is helpful but rather slow and English could be better. And you're paying a lot for it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service was very slow. After first room cleaning there were no new towels left in the room. I've requested new ones and eventually got them after 2 hours, asking three times.
reviews.title: Great hotel...not so great location

description: InterContinental Nairobi has for years been an oasis of luxury for business travellers as well as those who want to experience the wonders of Africa. The Parliament buildings are a short stroll away, Kenyatta International Convention Centre is right next door and Nairobi National Park, Museum Hill and the Elephant Orphanage are within easy reach.
